Description: Aetna, CareFirst BlueChoice, and UnitedHealthcare each agreed to pay $50,000 in settlement of allegations they provided flawed health directories that made it difficult for consumers to access mental health services.

Company: Group Hospitalization and Medical Services, Inc.
Agency: District of Columbia Department of Insurance, Securities and Banking

Description: CareFirst agreed to pay $6,168,545 in restitution and interest in settlement of allegations it paid below the minimum required for health care claims made for professional services from non-participating providers. The restitution had already been paid and a $5,000 civil penalty was stayed.

Notes: Revision of earlier order with a $13,900 penalty reduced the violations so a refund of $2,100 was ordered.

Company: Group Hospitalization and Medical Services, Inc.
